ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Exception when instantiating Processor (when launching crawl job with a custom processor)
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Jean-Noël Rivasseau, have you tried implementing the interface org.archive.state.Initializable and put your initial code in the initialTasks-method?

Hi Jean-Noël Rivasseau,

have you tried implementing the interface
org.archive.state.Initializable and put your initial code in the
initialTasks-method?


Christian



Jean-Noël Rivasseau schrieb:
> *bump*
> 
> Still not understanding why this happens.
> 
> On Thu, May 15, 2008 at 10:24 AM, Jean-Noël Rivasseau <elvanor@...> wrote:
>> Hmm, no I am not debugging in Eclipse or doing anything fancy there...
>>
>> On Thu, May 15, 2008 at 2:28 AM, Ryan Smith <ryan.justin.smith@...> wrote:
>>> Not sure if this is going to help you, but i was getting a similar error
>>> when trying to debug in eclipse, and i jsut laoded all the binary 2rd party
>>> lib jars on the runtime classpath and then i could use the webui fine.
>>>
>>> I was having this error happen to me when i tried to edit a global Sheet
>>> config.
>>>
>>> On Wed, May 14, 2008 at 10:03 AM, Jean-Noël Rivasseau <elvanor@...>
>>> wrote:
>>>> Hello, I am very new to Heritrix and am using 2.0.0. When I launch a
>>>> job I get the following exception:
>>>>
>>>> I noticed this happens whenever I have a constructor defined in my
>>>> custom Processor class that extends org.archive.modules.Processor.
>>>>
>>>> This happens even if the constructor code is totally empty. If I
>>>> remove the constructor everything works. However having a constructor
>>>> to perform initialization would be nice...
>>>>
>>>> Am I doing something wrong? Any help appreciated.
>>>>
>>>> Thanks,
>>>>
>>>> Jean-Noel
>>>>
>>>> javax.management.ReflectionException
